qas.question: How was the earliest clothing kept on the body?
What does clothing materials do more quickly compared to stone and bone?
Who has identified needles from about 30,000 B.C.?
Where have flax fibers which may have been used in clothing found?
The earliest clothing was pinned to what?

plausible_answers.text: stone, bone, shell and metal artifacts

qas.question: Clothing material deteriorates slowly compared to what?
Where have we not yet found flax fibers
Archaeologists have found early metal needles from when?

context: According to archaeologists and anthropologists, the earliest clothing likely consisted of fur, leather, leaves, or grass that were draped, wrapped, or <a0_0>tied around<a0_0/> the <b5_0>body.<b5_0/> Knowledge of such clothing remains inferential, since clothing materials <a1_0>deteriorate<a1_0/> quickly compared to <b6_0>stone, bone, shell and metal artifacts<b6_0/>. <a2_0>Archeologists<a2_0/> have identified very early sewing needles of bone and ivory from about <b8_0>30,000 BC,<b8_0/> found near Kostenki, Russia in 1988. <a4_0>Dyed flax fibers<a4_0/> that could have been used in clothing have been found in <a3_0>a <b7_0>prehistoric cave<b7_0/><a3_0/> in the Republic of Georgia that date back to 36,000 BP.
